Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration and Refugee Board breached principles of natural justice by failing to address unique evidence in individual refugee claims
Decision_Level: Administrative decision by the Immigration and Refugee Board
Credibility_Assessment: Doubts raised due to failure to assess individual evidence
Legal_Provision: Rule 49(1) of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to threats and assaults in Guyana
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to consider unique circumstances of each applicant
Application_Error: Failure to provide reasons addressing each claimant's unique circumstances
Review_Outcome: Matter referred back for reconsideration by a different panel
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness, with elements of correctness for legal questions
Outcome_of_Review: Allowed â€“ remitted for new hearing
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient reasoning and lack of individualized assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address unique evidence per claimant
Procedural_Fairness: Breach of duty to provide fair and individualized hearing
Credibility_Issues: Potential impact on credibility assessment due to generic dismissal
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on breach of natural justice and failure to follow procedural rules
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal immigration and refugee law
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Rule 49(1) of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Procedural_Issue: Failure to honor undertaking to consider individual circumstances
